title: Display goes wrong on external display
content:
When using an external display, only Thunderbird may appear larger. (See attached image.) 

This phenomenon does not appear on all displays, but only when using a Philips monitor.

Since this problem appears only in Thunderbird, it cannot be solved by changing the resolution of the PC.

Also, even if it is Philips, the display may still be correct. Rebooting does not solve the problem. The same phenomenon occurs with mirroring.

Please let me know if you know of any solution to this problem, as I will describe my operating environment below.

Thunderbird 128.6.1esr (64ビット)

--PC MacBook Pro (12-inch, M1, 2020) macOS Big Sur 11.3

--Display PHILIPS 271E1

--How to connect to the external display

MacBookPro 

- Anker PowerExpand 6-in-1 USB-C PD (Hub) - HDMI cable - Philips 17inch display

title: CalDAV: Item changed on server: How do i disable the PopUp?
content:
Hello,

I have several CalDAV calendars from my Nextcloud server integrated into my Thunderbird 128.6.1esr (64-bit) on Windows 11 24H2. I synchronize every minute. Sometimes, when opening Thunderbird, a message "Item changed on server" appears with the options "Submit my changes anyway" or "Discard my changes and reload".

By default, Thunderbird adopts the server entry. I notice this when I simply close the dialog with "x". For me, the calendar items on the server always have priority. Therefore, my question is, can I set this through the Config Editor so that this pop-up is not displayed? This way, the server entries are always automatically loaded in the background. I can't find a suitable solution, which has somewhat surprised me.

Attached is a screenshot from my documentation, hence the red rectangles.

Thank you very much!
creator: serjoscha

title: “The message could not be moved or copied to folder ‘Trash on rtegethoff@verizon.net because writing folder failed. To gain disk space, from the File menu, first choose Empty Trash, and then  Compact Folders and then try again.”
content:
I use Verizon.net whish has long been aliased to AOL.com and “pop” it down to Tbird. This has worked flawlessly for many years. On 01/24/2025 I was routinely clearing my inbox and got this message.

“The message could not be moved or copied to folder ‘Trash on rtegethoff@verizon.net because writing folder failed. To gain disk space, from the File menu, first choose Empty Trash, and then Compact Folders and then try again.”

I assumed this meant my Inbox folder was too big so I attempted to Delete one and then a number of old emails but got this same message. I thought maybe my Junk or Trash folders were too big so I managed to Delete all messages and Compacted both folders. With both Junk and Trash folders cleared to zero, I still got the above message when I tried to Delete a message from my Inbox. When I request new messages from AOL/Verizon email server I see the first 1 or 2 messages but then the above message appears and no new messages appear in my Tbird Inbox. When I log on directly to this account that is aliased on AOL.com I see many new messages. Next I tried to send a message using Tbird to my gmail.com account and the message is received at gmail.com but there is no new entry my Tbird Sent folder. I am running WINDOWS 10 McAfee Antivirus Version 1.25.208 16.0.R125 and I turned off the McAfee software and still failed. I, also, ran the PC in SAFE MODE and still failed. I am running Tbird version 128.6.0esr. There is an update listed as 128.6.1esr and I attempted to update but again got the same above message. Any help resolving this issue would be greatly appreciate
creator: rtegethoff

title: Barra de pesquisa não busca os emails
content:
Olá,

Recentemente, tenho enfrentado problemas ao realizar pesquisas no Thunderbird. Por exemplo, quando recebo um e-mail com o título "Lagos", consigo abri-lo normalmente, mas ao tentar pesquisar esse título na barra de pesquisa, o e-mail não aparece nos resultados. Esse problema tem ocorrido com vários outros e-mails também.

Já verifiquei se há algum filtro que possa estar interferindo, mas não encontrei nada que possa estar causando isso — o problema parece ser apenas na pesquisa.

Curiosamente, em alguns casos, quando abro e fecho o e-mail novamente, a pesquisa começa a funcionar corretamente. No entanto, isso não acontece em todas as situações. Esse comportamento tem causado atrasos significativos nas minhas tarefas, e gostaria de resolver isso o quanto antes.

Agradeço desde já por qualquer orientação ou solução que possa me ajudar.

title: How to get Thunderbird Address Book export to default to LDIF file format?...
content:
How to get Thunderbird Address Book export to default to LDIF file format?

Each time I export the address book it defaults to CSV format and I have to manually change it LDIF.

Thanks for your continued support of an incredible product! I'll keep up my annual donations to Mozilla ($100) and to the Thunderbird team ($500).

Why do I want this?

I export my address book as LDIF several times per day.

As I said at: - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1935803

I am a SERIOUS Thunderbird user.

A user for 30 years (counting a decade of Netscape Messenger). I currently have about 500,000 messages in nearly 1,000 folders, and an address book of nearly 4,000 entries. I spend several hours per day in Thunderbird, reading and sending email, reading technical and financial newsletters, plus current news and events, etc. Talking to clients, colleagues, friends and family.

But, I also have significant home-grown email infrastructure. I use it for mass-mailings of tips to the thousands of subscribers on my various mailing lists. I manage all of the mailing lists via the UI of Thunderbird, export them as LDIF files, and use home-grown software to read the LDIF files and generate the mailing list format used by my custom software.

Thunderbird is VASTLY superior to Outlook, Gmail, or any of the other alternatives! Not only in terms of feature set, but also speed, reliability, standards compliance, Unix-style use of plain text for portability, etc.

For more info about my usage of Thunderbird, see: - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1935803

Thanks! --Fred
creator: fred151
